Installation¶

Dependencies¶

UQA depends on the following libraries:

  • Click: A framework for writing command line interfaces.

  • spaCy: An easy to use Natural language processing (NLP) framework mantaining recent pre-trained models for various language.

  • colorama: Cross-platform library for colorized console outputing.

  • Benepar: A multilingual constituency parser library that integrates with spaCy and NLTK

Warning

  • Benepar requires Cython and NumPy to be installed prior to installing the library

  • Benepar depends on tensorflow but isn’t compatible with tensorflow>=2.0 at the time of writing

Optional Dependencies¶

  • ujson: A fast JSON encoder/decoder library

Installation with tensorflow==1.X¶

Install numpy and Cypthon:

$ pip install numpy Cython

Install tensorflow<2.0:

$ pip install tensorflow==1.15

Install the uqa package, in the project root directory:

$ pip install .

or in editable mode:

$ pip install -e .

Installation with tensorflow==2.X¶

Follow the previously described steps but install whatever version of tensorflow==2.X you want to use.

After the uqa package installation find the file benepar/base_parser.py in your python site-packages directory and edit the first line from:

import tensorflow as tf

to:

import tensorflow.compat.v1 as tf

and save.

Installation with GPU support¶

Both SpaCy and Benepar support GPU acceleration. Refer to their documentation to enable GPU support for this package.

If both SpaCy and Benepar are installed with GPU acceleration support then adding::

spacy.require_gpu()

or::

spacy.prefer_gpu()

before models loadings should be enough to use GPUs.
